title: Asian shares hit fresh six-week lows ahead of crucial U.S.-China trade talks
text: Asian shares hit six-week lows in early trade on Thursday as increased tensions ahead of key Sino-U.S. trade negotiations fanned fresh concerns about the outlook for the global economy.

title: Is The Market Crashing? Time To Sell Stocks?
text: Sell in May and go away has a special appeal this year, as trade tensions rock the markets, values plunge, and the blue sky becomes suddenly cloudy. Should you sell, re-calibrate, or bid your time?

title: Pharma ads will soon be required to include drug prices
text: Pharmaceutical companies will soon be required to include their products’ prices in TV ads, under a new rule that the Trump administration hopes will drive down prescription-drug costs, officials said Wednesday. The Department of Health and Human Services regulation, slated to take effect in July, will require commercials to display a drug’s Wholesale Acquisition Cost.

title: Stock Market Pulls Back On Worries Over Trade
text: Is the latest market pullback just noise or a sign of something much worse? Commonwealth CIO Brad McMillan looks at the big picture.

title: Slack to livestream pitch to shareholders on Monday ahead of direct listing
text: Slack will make its pitch to prospective shareholders on Monday at an invite-only event in New York City.

title: Huawei says detained CFO to seek extradition stay, rights violated
text: Huawei said on Wednesday that it will seek to stay extradition proceedings against its detained chief financial officer, saying her business activities were conducted with the full knowledge of banking officials.

title: This is not the best time to start a trade war, economist says
text: The economy may seem strong enough to weather a trade war, but Strategas' chief economist says it's not really a good time.

title: Huawei CFO Meng arrives in Canada court for pre-extradition hearing
text: Huawei Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou arrived in a Canadian courtroom on Wednesday to begin what is expected to be a long legal battle against the United States' request that she be extradited to face fraud charges.

title: Wall St. struggles to hold on to gains ahead of pivotal trade talks
text: U.S. stocks flitted between gains and losses on Wednesday, as investors assessed the latest developments on trade, ahead of a crucial round of talks between the United States and China.

title: The first Chinese automaker sets sights on US with start-up Zotye taking on big rivals in Detroit
text: With a name that few Americans will likely know how to pronounce — it's Zoh-tee, not Zot-yee — a small budget and even less brand equity than bigger Chinese brands like BYD, Geely or Great Wall, there are plenty of skeptics.

title: Wall St. struggles for direction as crucial trade talks loom
text: U.S. stocks flitted between gains and losses on Wednesday, as investors digested a mixed flow of news on trade, ahead of a critical round of talks between the United States and China.

title: China says it will take 'necessary' countermeasures if US raises tariffs Friday
text: China has promised to take "necessary countermeasures" against the U.S. if Washington follows through on its threat to increase tariffs.

title: Rent the Runway just opened its largest brick-and-mortar store yet

title: BNP Paribas - Buy This Out Of Favour French Bank

title: More Pressure On Stocks As Trade Issues Start To Look Complicated
text: The tariff situation continues to suck all of the air out of the room, with stocks under early pressure again. How much of a trade premium had been built into the market over the last month or two is an open question, but some of it is being extracted.

title: Bird is now selling its electric scooters directly to consumers
text: Bird, recognizing the growing possibility that people will want to own electric scooters rather than share them, is launching a new scooter model available for purchase. Called the Bird One, it will be available for ownership and shared use cases.

title: White House requires Big Pharma to list drug prices on TV ads as soon as this summer
text: Pharmaceutical companies will be required to disclose the price of its prescription medicines in television commercials, the Trump administration announced.

title: Element Solutions (ESI) Q1 Earnings Top, Sales Lag Estimates
text: Adjusted earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter were 20 cents, which surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 18 cents.

title: U.S. Futures, Europe Stocks Edge Higher After Rout: Markets Wrap
text: U.S. equity-index futures and European stocks edged higher on Wednesday, shrugging off declines across Asia as markets showed signs of stabilizing.

title: Copper Deficit Predictions Grow And Central Banks Keep Stocking Gold
text: The world is on a path to vast shortages in copper, nickel, lithium and other important minerals that are necessary to build the batteries in electric vehicles.

title: Nasdaq: The pipeline for Chinese companies listing in the US is 'stronger than it's ever been'
text: There have been 12 Asia-Pacific companies that have listed on the Nasdaq so far this year, raising a total of $777 million at their debuts.
